text: BOX 15 FIGO recommends that all obstetricians are familiar with resuscitative measures in the context of PPH including massive transfusion protocols.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: 48 |    ESCOBAR Et Al.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: 12  |  KEY STATEMENTS 1.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: Care bundles have been associated with improved patientoutcomes when adherence is high.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: The goal of the PPH bun-dle is to reduce the frequency of severe hemorrhage and improve maternal outcomes.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: There is still a need for good-quality research to determine whether the bundle approach will ultimately make a difference in saving women's lives from PPH.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: In recent years new scientific evidence and the availability ofnew technologies have driven important reflections about PPH.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: To guarantee quality of guidelines it is important to update the evidence and base recommendations on the best quality stud- ies available.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: It is also essential to stimulate production of newresearch on the key themes of PPH to reduce disparities among guidelines.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: PPH guidelines have helped improve the care ofwomen around the world and their use should be stimulated in all scenarios.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: The shock index indicator defined as the ratio of heart rate tosystolic blood pressure is simple to use.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: It has better predictiveability than other vital signs because it detects acute changes in the maternal cardiovascular system and appears as an early marker to predict adverse outcomes.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: Evidence continues to support oxytocin as the first- line drug inthe prevention of PPH in all births.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: Women with PPH should receive a fixed dose of 1 g tranexamicacid in 10 ml (100 mg/ml) intravenously (1 ml/min) as soon as possible after delivery and no more than 3 h after birth.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: A sec-ond dose of 1 g should be given intravenously if bleeding con- tinues after 30 min or restarts within 24 h of the first dose.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: Tranexamic acid should be given in addition to usual treatments for the management of PPH including medical (uterotonics)  nonsurgical and surgical interventions regardless of the cause of hemorrhage or the mode of delivery.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: The nonpneumatic antishock garment (NASG) is an effectivenonsurgical device that should be in every healthcare facility.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: The NASG when used as a temporizing measure to recover hemodynamic stability in the context of PPH decreases mor- bidity mortality and hypovolemic shock and is of special impor- tance in LMICs.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: While considerable research is still necessary toimprove knowledge on implementation issues professional as- sociations and national and international guidelines should con- tinue to encourage NASG use for refractory PPH management.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: Uterine balloon tamponade (UBT) is an effective nonsurgicaltechnique that when employed rapidly by a properly trained person with a proven device in the context of quality PPH care (the PPH bundle) improves survival of women with refractory PPH.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: National and international guidelines should include UBTuse in the management of PPH.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: Interventional radiology may be indicated for the preventionand treatment of PPH either before delivery in cases of known placental abnormalities and implantation or after delivery when the patient is hemorrhaging.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: Prophylactic catheterization of theuterine arteries with embolization can be considered an impor- tant therapeutic strategy that is safe and effective for reducing maternal and fetal morbidity and mortality by controlling blood loss.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: Regardless of the compression suture chosen obstetriciansmust first quickly recognize the onset of PPH safely admin- ister uterotonics and place emergent compression sutures if needed.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: In the immediate postoperative period womenshould be monitored for complications such as hematometra  pyometra and uterine synechiae.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: Most important is the abilityof the obstetrician to control bleeding using medical and sur- gical interventions stabilize the mother and reduce maternal morbidity.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: PPH is a serious life- threatening obstetric emergency and earlyrecognition of this condition results in better outcomes.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: In caseswhere medical treatment fails to control the bleeding several surgical options exist.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: To date no randomized controlled trialshave assessed these techniques nor compared the superiority of one to another and all the data are based on case reports and case series.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: Moreover the use of these methods largely dependson the facilities provided in each institution and on the care pro- viders’ skills and familiarity with the procedures.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: Hence an ef-fort should be exercised for better training of all care providers in these life- saving techniques.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: Future fertility rate following theseprocedures remains underassessed due to the lack of long- term follow- up for these cases.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: In the future more research shouldtarget these surgical techniques to shy away from the more morbid procedures thereby improving maternal and perinatal outcomes.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: Damage control resuscitation (DCS) is a combination of resuscita-tion and surgical interventions with the purpose of restoring he- mostasis and normal physiology.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: These techniques have proven tobe applicable in obstetrics with satisfactory results controlling re- fractory PPH and an overall decreased mortality of critically ill pa- tients especially in patients in whom conventional treatment can be linked to a high risk of failure.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: DCS is an available therapeuticapproach for the management of severe PPH thus proper training must be widespread to implement this technique.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: Basic recommendations for resuscitation in PPH include admin-istration of crystalloids in small boluses of 500 ml checking clini- cal signs and looking for its improvement and use of balanced crystalloid solutions such as Ringer's lactate which is preferred over chlorine- rich solutions.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: The target blood pressure in hypo-tensive resuscitation is 80– 90 mm Hg for systolic blood pressure or 50– 60 mm Hg for mean blood pressure.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: In hemostatic reanimation fewer crystalloids are administeredand instead transfusional replacement is started earlier with high ratios of transfusion (1:1:1).

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: During massive transfusionsthe target for serum fibrinogen is 150– 200 mg/dl and the usual dose of cryoprecipitate is 10 units it is estimated that these will raise the serum fibrinogen by 100 mg/dl.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: The protocol for mas-sive transfusion is specific at each institution.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: Physicians shouldbe familiar with their hospitals’ protocol and recommendations.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: |  49 ESCOBAR Et Al.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: Anyone who attends a birth can be taught simple home- based life-saving skills.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: The evidence- based prevention and management ofPPH can be achieved with the use of relatively inexpensive drugs.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: Women should be monitored closely during the first hour after de- livery of the baby and placenta and accurate blood loss measure- ment should be implemented.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: Barriers and gaps can be addressedthrough providing an enabling environment through supportive policies designing a formal plan for supplies task shifting strategies  and use of guidelines and protocols for successful implementation.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: Simulation training on how to manage PPH is encouraged andeach hospital should have a protocol on the management of PPH.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: OBGYN societies should lobby to have the essential medi-cations that are needed to prevent and treat PPH readily avail- able in all maternity centers.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: 50 |    ESCOBAR Et Al.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: 13  |  IMPLEMENTATION OF THE FIGO RECOMMENDATIONS BY HEALTH SYSTEMS AND NATIONAL SOCIETIES FOR THE MANAGEMENT OF POSTPARTUM HEMORRHAGE 1.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: FIGO must lobby and work with other international organi-zations to reduce maternal mortality and morbidity due to PPH.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: FIGO recommends that all national societies work in collaborationwith nurses and midwives to lobby with their respective regional and national organizations to promote and implement these recommendations.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: All OBGYN societies in conjunction with other healthcare socie-ties must endorse a strategy for effective prevention and treat- ment of PPH.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: All national societies must lobby with their local nationalgovernments to establish a PPH bundle approach and make the medical supplies and surgical equipment needed for the management of PPH readily available in all regions of their countries.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: All health systems are obligated to provide respectful care of thewoman the infant and the associated family.

fname: FIGO recommendations on the management of postpartum hemorrhage 2022
text: Health systemsmust provide the appropriate and effective medications water  oxygen equipment training and transfer mechanisms to save the lives of women and newborns.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: C.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Aldo Enrique Cadena Rojas Secretario Distrital de Salud Giovanni Rubiano García Subsecretario Distrital de Salud Elsa Graciela Martínez Echeverry Directora de Desarrollo de Servicios Consuelo Peña Aponte Profesional especializada Área de Análisis y Políticas Martha Lucía Mora Moreno Profesional especializada Grupo Materno Perinatal 3 Guía de hemorragia posparto Código Rojo 1.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Justificación y definición1.1 Justificación Es un hecho reconocido a nivel mundial que la oportunidad y la calidad de la atención en el manejo de la hemorragia obstétrica son fundamentales para disminuir las com- plicaciones y la mortalidad.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Las principales razones para la alta mortalidad asociada a hemorragia son: la demora en el reconocimiento de la hipovolemia falla en el reem- plazo adecuado del volumen y demora en la intervención quirúrgica (1).

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: La mortalidad materna es de 400 por 100.000 nacidos vivos lo que significa 529.000 muertes por año.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: De estas muertes aproximadamente 150.000 son debidas a hemorra- gias obstétricas la mayoría por hemorragia posparto (HPP) que en muchos países es la primera o segunda causa de mortalidad materna (1-3).

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: En Bogotá D.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: C.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: en 2012-2013 esta pérdida de sangre fue la primera causa de mortali- dad materna: 12 casos (29%) en el 2012 7 casos (29%) en el 2013 (2).

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: El “código rojo” consiste en crear un esquema de trabajo organizado de tal manera que cuando se presente una hemorragia obstétrica le permita al equipo asistencial seguir los pasos indicados sin desviarse del objetivo trabajar de manera ordenada y coordi- nada y que pueda ser replicado en cada situación específica logrando así disminuir la morbimortalidad generada por esta causa (nivel de evidencia 3 grado de recomendación C) (1 4).

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: 1.2 Niveles de evidencia y grados de recomendación (clasificación de Oxford) (5) Niveles de evidencia 1++ Metaanálisis de alta calidad revisiones sistemáticas de ensayos clínicos o ensayos clínicos de alta calidad con muy poco riesgo de sesgo.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: 1+ Metaanálisis bien realizados revisiones sistemáticas de ensayos clínicos o ensayos clínicos bien realizados con poco riesgo de sesgos.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: 1- Metaanálisis revisiones sistemáticas de ensayos clínicos o ensayos clínicos con alto riesgo de sesgos.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: 2++ Revisiones sistemáticas de alta calidad de estudios de cohortes o de casos y controles.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Estudios de cohortes o de casos y controles con riesgo muy bajo de sesgo y con alta probabilidad de establecer una relación causal.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: 2+ Estudios de cohortes o de casos y controles bien realizados con bajo riesgo de sesgo y con una moderada proba- bilidad de establecer una relación causal.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: 2- Estudios de cohortes o de casos y controles con alto riesgo de sesgo y riesgo significativo de que la relación no sea causal.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: 3 Estudios no analíticos como informes de casos y series de casos.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: 4 Opinión de expertos.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Guía de hemorragia posparto - Código Rojo 4 Grados de recomendación A Por lo menos un metaanálisis revisión sistemática o ensayo clínico clasificado como 1++ y directamente aplicable a la población diana de la guía o un volumen de evidencia científica compuesto por estudios clasificados como 1+ y con gran consistencia entre ellos.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: B Un volumen de evidencia científica compuesta por estudios clasificados como 2++ directamente aplicable a la pobla- ción diana de la guía y que demuestran gran consistencia entre ellos o evidencia científica extrapolada desde estudios clasificados como 1++ o 1+.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: C Un volumen de evidencia científica compuesta por estudios clasificados como 2+ directamente aplicables a la pobla- ción diana de la guía y que demuestran gran consistencia entre ellos o evidencia científica extrapolada desde estudios clasificados como 2++.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: D Evidencia científica de nivel 3 o 4 o evidencia científica extrapolada desde estudios clasificados como 2+.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Los estudios clasificados como 1- y 2- no deben usarse en el proceso de elaboración de recomendaciones por su alto potencial de sesgo.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: 1.3 Definición de hemorragia posparto Se considera hemorragia posparto si se presenta alguna de las siguientes situaciones:  Pérdida estimada de más de 500 cm3 de sangre en el posparto o más de 1.000 cm3 poscesárea o menor con signos de choque (3 4).

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Pérdida de todo el volumen sanguíneo en 24 horas.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Sangrado mayor a 150 cm3/min.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Pérdida del 50% del volumen en 20 minutos.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Descenso del hematocrito mayor o igual al 10%.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Objetivos y población objeto2.1 Objetivo general Implementar una guía que unifique el diagnóstico y manejo de la hemorragia posparto y que contribuya a disminuir la mortalidad materna asociada a hemorragia.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: 2.2 Objetivos específicos  Protocolizar las mejores prácticas para el manejo de la hemorragia posparto.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Facilitar el reconocimiento de la paciente con hemorragia posparto e introducir el diagnóstico rutinario y objetivo del choque hipovolémico.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Disminuir la tasa de morbimortalidad materna y perinatal en los casos de hemorra- gia durante la atención del parto.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Proporcionar las herramientas y sensibilizar a los profesionales de salud para que los tratamientos se realicen de la forma más oportuna y adecuada.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Establecer medidas universales para la prevención de la hemorragia posparto.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Guía de hemorragia posparto - Código Rojo 5 2.3 Población objeto Todas las mujeres gestantes o en puerperio atendidas en Bogotá que presenten hemo- rragia obstétrica.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Factores de riesgo clasificación del choque hipovolémico etiología3.1 Etiología y factores de riesgo Aproximadamente dos terceras partes (66%) de los casos de hemorragia posparto no tienen un factor de riesgo conocido por este motivo es indispensable aplicar las medi- das preventivas a toda la población obstétrica.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Una adecuada atención prenatal puede identificar a aquellas pacientes que tienen uno o más factores de riesgo para presentar hemorragia posparto (tablas 1 y 2) (4).

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Tabla 1.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Factores de riesgo para hemorragia posparto (4)Factores de riesgo OR ajustado Placenta previa 13 1 Abrupcio de placenta 12 6 Cesárea de emergencia 3 6 Enfermedad de von Willebrand 3 3 Corioamnionitis 2 5 Cesárea electiva 2 5 Embarazo gemelar 2 3 Peso fetal >4.500 g 1 9 Polihidramnios 1 9 Multiparidad 1 9 Síndrome de HELLP 1 9 Parto instrumentado fórceps 1 9 Inducción de trabajo de parto 1 6 Obesidad 1 6 Antecedente de HPP 1 6 Cesárea previa 1 5 Trabajo de parto prolongado 1 1 Edad >40 años 1 4 Guía de hemorragia posparto - Código Rojo 6 Identifique factores de riesgo para coagulopatía (historia clínica estructurada): 1.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Sangrado genital abundante desde la menarquía.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Uno de los siguientes:  Hemorragia posparto  Sangrado relacionado con un procedimiento quirúrgico  Sangrado relacionado con un procedimiento dental3.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Dos o más de los siguientes síntomas:  Equimosis una a dos veces al mes  Epistaxis una a dos veces al mes  Sangrado frecuente de encías  Antecedentes familiares de síntomas de sangradoSe considera tamizaje positivo para trastorno de la hemostasia si cumple con uno o más de los ítems 1 2 3 de la historia clínica estructurada (nivel de evidencia 2 grado de recomendación B).

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Tabla 2.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Principales causas de hemorragia pospartoEtiología Causas Factores de riesgo Tono 70% Atonía uterina Sobredistensión uteri- na parto prolongado/ precipitado Gestación múltiple polihidramnios macrosomia gran multípara hidrocefalia severa Agotamiento muscular uterino Trabajo de parto prolongado corioamnionitis Trauma 20% Lesiones canal del parto Desgarros del canal del parto Parto intervenido parto precipitado episiotomía Ruptura uterina Parto intervenido cirugía uterina previa hiperdinamia Inversión uterina Acretismo maniobra de Crede excesiva tracción del cordón gran multípara Tejido 9% Retención de tejidos Retención de restos placentarios Acretismo placenta previa útero bicorne leiomiomatosis cirugía uterina previa Anormalidades de la placentación Trombina 1% Alteraciones de coagulación Adquiridas Preeclampsia HELLP embolia de líquido amniótico sepsis abrupcio de placenta  CID consumo transfusiones masivas Congénitas Enfermedad von Willebrand hemofilia A Fuente: Fescina et al.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: 3.2 Tipos de hemorragia posparto  Hemorragia temprana: es la que se presenta durante las primeras 24 horas del periodo posparto generalmente en las dos primeras horas es la más frecuente y grave (4 6).

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Hemorragia tardía: ocurre entre las 24 horas y las 6 semanas del posparto con una frecuencia entre el 5 y 10% de los partos (4 6).

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Guía de hemorragia posparto - Código Rojo 7 3.3 Diagnóstico y clasificación del choque hipovolémico El diagnóstico del choque es muy fácil en los casos extremos pero puede ser difícil en sus fases iniciales.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Se calcula que la cantidad de sangre perdida puede ser subestimada hasta en un 50% por lo que se recomienda clasificar el choque de acuerdo con el peor parámetro encontrado (no se recomienda hacerlo solo de acuerdo con la percepción subjetiva de la pérdida sanguínea) (nivel de evidencia 2 grado de recomendación B) (7).

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Los signos síntomas (sensorio perfusión pulso y presión arterial) y su relación con el grado de pérdida sanguínea y choque hipovolémico deben estar listados y expuestos (tabla de clasificación de choque y/o índice de choque) en el sitio de atención de par- tos cesárea y recuperación posparto con el fin de orientar las estrategias de manejo (tabla 3).

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Tabla 3.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Estimación de las pérdidas de acuerdo con la evaluación del estado de choque (7)Clasificación del choque hipovolémico Pérdida de volumen (%) y ml para una mujer entre 50-70 kg Sensorio Perfusión Pulso Presión arterial sistólica (mm/hg) Grado del choque 10-15% 500-1.000 mL Normal Normal 60-90 >90 Compensado 16-25% 1.000-1.500 mL Normal y/o agitada Palidez frialdad 91-100 80-90 Leve 26-35% 1.500-2.000 mL Agitada Palidez frialdad más sudoración 101-120 70-79 Moderado >35% >2.000 mL Letárgica o inconsciente Palidez frialdad más sudoración y llenado capilar >3 segundos >120 <70 Severo Fuente: Baskett (7).

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Secuencia temporal del código rojoPrincipios de manejo  Reposición adecuada de cristaloides de acuerdo con la clasificación del estadio de choque (nivel de evidencia 1 grado de recomendación A).

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Considerar coagulación intravascular diseminada por consumo después de una hora de choque.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Decisión oportuna del manejo quirúrgico (nivel de evidencia 2 grado de recomen- dación B).

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Guía de hemorragia posparto - Código Rojo 8 Secuencia temporal  Minuto 0: activación  La institución debe tener un sistema de activación que permita al personal ente- rarse inmediatamente de la emergencia.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Determinar sensorio perfusión pulso presión arterial y oximetría.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Clasificar el choque  Cuando se activa un código rojo en baja complejidad se debe alertar al operador de radio enfermera jefe primer y segundo médico auxiliares de enfermería labo- ratorio clínico.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Cuando se activa un código rojo en mediana y alta complejidad se debe alertar al ginecólogo anestesiólogo segundo médico enfermera jefe auxiliares de apoyo  laboratorio clínico camillero banco de sangre.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Minuto 1 a 20: reanimación  Oxígeno por cánula a 3 L/min (nivel de evidencia 2 grado de recomendación B).

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Canalizar 2 venas calibre grueso catéter 14 o 16.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Tomar muestras (CH hemoclasificación TP TPT fibrinógeno).

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Iniciar infusión de 500 mL de cristaloides calientes y continuar con bolos de 300 a 500 cm3 de acuerdo con la respuesta hemodinámica.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Pasar sonda vesical a cistoflo para drenaje vesical y cuantificar diuresis.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Realizar masaje uterino bimanual (nivel de evidencia 2 grado de recomendación C).

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Revisión uterina bajo anestesia general: establezca diagnóstico etiológico (Nemo- tecnia 4 Ts).

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Aplicar medicamentos de primera línea: oxitocina misoprostol metilergonovina (8) (nivel de evidencia 2 grado de recomendación B).

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: − Oxitocina: a 40 U diluidas en 500 mL de cristaloides (para pasar en 4 horas a 125 mL/hora) (9) (nivel de evidencia 1).

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: − Metilergonovina amp.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: x 0 2 mg: 1 ampolla IM (10) (nivel de evidencia 1).

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: − Misoprostol tabletas x 200 mcg 5 tabletas intrarrectales (11 12).

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Evite la hipotermia: utilice sábanas o mantas precalentadas y todos los cristaloi- des adminístrelos calientes (nivel de evidencia 3 grado de recomendación D).

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Medicamentos de primera línea Oxitocina 40 unidades intravenoso en 500 cm3 de Lactato Ringer.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Pasar a 125 cm3 hora (160 mUI/min).

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Misoprostol 1.000 mcg intrarrectal.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Metilergonovina 0 2 mg intramuscular.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: En los niveles de baja complejidad todas las pacientes en quienes se activó un código rojo deben ser trasladadas al nivel de mediana o alta complejidad más cercano de forma inmediata posterior al manejo inicial.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: En choque severo o índice de choque mayor de 1 (Indicador: frecuencia cardiaca/sistó- lica) inicie transfusión inmediata con las dos primeras unidades de sangre sin cruzar Guía de hemorragia posparto - Código Rojo 9 –O negativo si no está disponible puede usar O positivo– y solicite las unidades adi- cionales cruzadas.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Recuerde que si transfunde seis unidades o más de glóbulos rojos  debe conservar la relación 1:1:1 es decir por cada unidad de glóbulos rojos una de plasma y una de plaquetas (nivel de evidencia 2 grado de recomendación C).

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  20-60 minutos: estabilización  Conservar volumen circulante.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Atonía uterina: masaje uterino permanente (nivel de evidencia 2 grado de reco- mendación C).

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Usar oxitocina misoprostol o metilergonovina con dosis adicionales de acuerdo con criterio clínico.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: El ácido tranexámico se debe administrar en dosis de 1 g por vía IV cada 6 horas  mínimo 4 dosis en las siguientes situaciones: − Hemorragia posparto secundaria a traumatismo del canal del parto.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: − Sospecha de trastornos de la coagulación por historia clínica.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: − Hemorragia posparto que no ceda al manejo médico después de la aplicación de las medidas iniciales (13) (niveles de evidencia 2 y 3 grado de recomendación C).

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Iniciar inotrópicos y vasoactivos si persiste la hipotensión.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Escenario 1 Si la paciente continúa inestable hemodinámicamente: choque moderado severo o con sangrado activo abundante pasar a cirugía para histerectomía abdominal subto- tal total y empaquetamiento con tracción según criterio clínico (figura 1) (nivel de evidencia 2 grado de recomendación C).

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: En caso de sangrado en capa se recomienda desempaquetar al completar 12 a 24 horas posterior al procedimiento de acuerdo con la evolución clínica.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: El procedimiento quirúrgico debe ser definido en conjunto con el segundo ginecólogo (14).

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Figura 1.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Empaquetamiento con tracciónFuente: Modificada a partir de Hallak et al.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Guía de hemorragia posparto - Código Rojo 10 Los manejos quirúrgicos conservadores como sutura hemostática de B-Lynch tapona- miento uterino ligadura de arterias uterinas ligadura de arterias hipogástricas no se recomiendan en pacientes con choque severo porque la evidencia es insuficiente (nivel de evidencia 3 grado de recomendación D) (14).

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Escenario 2 Si la paciente mejora con el manejo inicial —estabilidad hemodinámica y sangrado escaso—:  Vigile el sangrado vaginal y el tono uterino cada 15 minutos durante 4 horas.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Evalúe signos de perfusión (sensorio llenado oximetría pulso y tensión arterial  cada 15 minutos).

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Si fue una hemorragia por atonía vigile el tono uterino cada 15 minutos.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Continúe los líquidos IV a razón de 200 mL/hora.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Continúe los uterotónicos por 24 horas si fue una atonía: 10 unidades de oxito- cina en cada 500 cm3 de L.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Ringer.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Mantenga la oxigenación.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Defina la transfusión si es necesario (hemoglobina <7 g/dL índice de choque mayor a 1 o según criterio clínico).

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Aplicación de antibiótico profiláctico de acuerdo con el protocolo institucional.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  60 minutos y más: manejo avanzado  Pasado este tiempo se considera que la paciente cursa con coagulación intravascular  diseminada de consumo.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Iniciar plasma fresco y plaquetas relación glóbulos rojos 1: plasma 1: plaquetas 1.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: En caso de hemotransfusión masiva (mayor de 6 unidades de glóbulos rojos) ini- ciar plasma fresco y plaquetas relación glóbulos rojos 1: plasma 1: plaquetas: 1.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Manejarla en unidad de cuidados intermedios y verificar si cumple criterios de ingreso a unidad de cuidados intensivos.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Conservar volumen circulatorio.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Valorar gasto urinario.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Prevención 1.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Manejo activo tercer periodo.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Oxitocina 10 unidades diluidas endovenosas al salir hombro anterior para pasar en 10 minutos.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: En caso de no contar con vena canalizada aplicar 10 unidades de oxitocina intramuscular (nivel de evidencia 1 grado recomendación A) (2 16).

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Pinzamiento del cordón según protocolos.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Tracción controlada del cordón (17).

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Masaje uterino (17).

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: La carbetocina puede ser usada como medicamento alternativo a la oxitocina en pacientes con factores de riesgo para hemorragia posparto como embarazo geme-Guía de hemorragia posparto - Código Rojo 11 lar sobredistensión uterina miomatosis uterina polihidramnios corioamnionitis  abrupcio de placenta después del alumbramiento (2) (nivel de evidencia 2 grado de recomendación C).

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Vigilancia inmediata en posparto: evolución médica durante las dos primeras horas posparto o poscesárea para evaluar tono uterino sangrado y otras complicaciones (nivel de evidencia 3 grado de recomendación D).

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Organización del equipo de trabajoCon el fin de evitar el caos durante la asistencia a una situación crítica como es la hemo- rragia obstétrica con choque hipovolémico es necesario organizar el equipo humano disponible asignándole funciones específicas las cuales deben ser previamente cono- cidas y estudiadas en los entrenamientos institucionales y pueden ser asimiladas con la ayuda de la lista de chequeo del código rojo.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: La organización del equipo mejora las condiciones de trabajo y facilita la realización de las funciones para la recuperación y mantenimiento de la vida de la mujer en choque.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Cada miembro participante en el código rojo debe cumplir sus funciones con el fin de evitar la duplicación o la omisión de alguna de ellas.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: La activación del código la hace la primera persona que entra en contacto con la paciente que está sangrando.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Funciones de los participantes en el código rojo en niveles de mediana y alta complejidad Médico jefe Ginecólogo o médico que está atendiendo el parto o la cesárea.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Ubicación: lado derecho o frente al periné de la paciente.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Buscar la causa del choque.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Clasificar el estado de choque.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Practicar revisión uterina y cervicovaginal.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Hacer masaje uterino bimanual.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Dar orden verbal de colocación de líquidos hemoderivados y medicamentos de segunda línea.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Revaluar estado de choque posreanimación inicial.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Realizar los procedimientos quirúrgicos.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Levantar el código rojo.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Informar a los familiares.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Guía de hemorragia posparto - Código Rojo 12 Anestesiólogo  Ubicación: cabecera de la paciente.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Aplicar anestesia general.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Enfermera jefe  Ubicación: lado izquierdo de la paciente.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Aplicar y registrar medicamentos de primera línea sin solicitar orden médica escrita o verbal.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Colocar sonda vesical a cistoflo.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Supervisar las funciones del personal auxiliar de enfermería.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Aplicar y registrar medicamentos de segunda línea de acuerdo con orden verbal del médico jefe.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Administrar hemoderivadosAuxiliar 1 de enfermería  Canalizar segunda vía de acceso venoso calibre 14 o 16.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Tomar muestras sanguíneas.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Pasar Lactato de Ringer 500 cm3 en bolo caliente y continuar infusión de acuerdo con la orden verbal del médico jefe.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Auxiliar 2 de enfermería  Diligenciar las órdenes de laboratorio.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Marcar los tubos de muestra y garantizar que lleguen al laboratorio.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Ordenar por escrito los hemoderivados de acuerdo con la indicación verbal del ginecólogo.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Anotar los eventos con registro de tiempo en el formato de activación de código rojo.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Auxiliar 3 de enfermería  Suministrar canasta de código rojo.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Llamar a laboratorio camillero anestesiólogo segundo médico enfermera jefe  demás personal necesario.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Calentar líquidos.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Recibir la sangre solicitada.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Suministrar los elementos adicionales necesarios.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Guía de hemorragia posparto - Código Rojo 13 Camillero  Suspender todas las actividades al llamado de código rojo.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Tener disponibilidad inmediata en la puerta de la sala de partos.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Llevar las muestras debidamente marcadas al laboratorio.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Esperar los hemoderivados y entregarlos en sala de partos.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Retirarse de partos solo cuando el médico jefe levante el código rojo.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Laboratorio clínico  Recibir y procesar las muestras debidamente marcadas.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Enviar a obstetricia hemoderivados solicitados.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Segundo médico  Ubicación: lado izquierdo de la paciente.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Hacer masaje uterino bimanual.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text:  Apoyar la decisión de procedimientos quirúrgicos: histerectomía total  vs.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: subtotal.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Paciente menor de edad hija de padres seguidores de la iglesia Testigos de Jehová Maneje integralmente el código rojo sin considerar la determinación religiosa de los padres o del menor: “predomina el cuidado de la salud sobre los condicionantes reli- giosos” (1).

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: En caso de no contar con el personal suficiente mencionado anteriormente se deberán ajustar las funciones de acuerdo con la disponibilidad institucional.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Paciente que es atendida en un centro de baja complejidad Si la paciente ingresa con hemorragia posparto a uno de los centros de atención médica inmediata (CAMI) o de baja complejidad de atención se debe garantizar: Secuencia temporal  Minuto 0: activación − Determinar sensorio perfusión y signos vitales completos.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: − Alertar a laboratorio radio nivel de mediana o alta complejidad más cercano  segundo médico enfermera jefe y auxiliares de apoyo.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: − Iniciar calentamiento de líquidos.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Guía de hemorragia posparto - Código Rojo 14  Minuto 1 a 20: reanimación − Oxígeno por cánula a 3 L/min.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: − Canalizar 2 venas calibre grueso catéter 14 o 16.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: − Tomar muestras (CH hemoclasificación TP TPT fibrinógeno).

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: − 2.000 mL de Lactato Ringer en bolo caliente y continuar según orden médica.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: − Clasificar el choque.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: − Pasar sonda vesical a cistoflo.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: − Hacer revisión uterina.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: − Practicar masaje uterino bimanual.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: − Aplicar medicamentos de primera línea: oxitocina misoprostol methilergo- novina.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Medicamentos de primera línea Oxitocina 40 unidades intravenoso en 500 cm3 de Lactato Ringer pasar a 125 cm3 hora (160 mUI/mL).

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Misoprostol 1.000 mcg intrarrectal.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Metilergonovina 0 2 mg intramuscular.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Transporte inmediato al centro de atención de mediana o alta complejidad más cercano  de preferencia en ambulancia medicalizada con el equipo humano acompañante entrenado en código rojo y que continúe durante el desplazamiento con la aplicación del código con énfasis en el masaje uterino activo las maniobras de reanimación  reemplazo de volumen y administración de medicamentos (goteo de oxitocina en caso de atonía) (nivel de evidencia 3) acompañamiento a la familia con explicación clara y objetiva que proceda de quien asume el proceso de coordinación del código rojo.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Guía de hemorragia posparto - Código Rojo 15 Activación Sangrado mayor de 1000 cm3 Evaluar: TA FC perfusión sensorio Baja complejidad Mediana o alta complejidad Llamar a: Primer y segundo ginecólogos anestesió- logo médico hospitalario enfermera jefe  auxiliares camillero laboratorio.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Llamar a primer y segundo mé- dicos enfermera jefe auxiliares  camillero.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Avisar al CRUE.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Oxígeno por cánula a 3 l/min Canalizar 2 venas calibre grueso catéter 14 o 16.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Tomar muestra: CH hemoclasificación TP TPT fibrinógeno.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Bolo de 500 cm3 de cristaloides calientes y continuar con bolos de 300 a 500 cm3 de acuerdo con la respuesta hemodinámica.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Clasificar el choque.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Pasar sonda vesical a cistoflo.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Revisión uterina masaje uterino bimanual.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Oxitocina: 40 unidades en 500 cm3 Ringer a 125 cm3/hora.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Misoprostol: 1.000 mcg 5 tabletas intrarrectales Metilergonovina: 0 2 mg 1 ampolla IM.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Transfundir de acuerdo a orden verbal del ginecólogo jefe Traslado Inestabilidad hemodinámica o sangrado abundante Traslado a Unidad de cuidados Intermedios o Intensivos Vigile el sangrado vaginal cada 15 minutos por 4 h Evalúe sensorio perfusión pulso y TA cada 15 minutos Vigile la contracción uterina cada 15 minutos Continúe L.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Ringer a 200 ml/hora 10 unidades de oxitocina en cada 500 cm3 de L.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: Ringer.

fname: Guia Maternidad-Codigo Rojo colombia
text: O2 por cánula a 2 l/min Defina la transfusión si es necesario Flujograma de manejo Estabilidad hemodinámica y sangrado escaso Reclasificar choque y respuesta  a manejo inicial Guía de hemorragia posparto - Código Rojo 16 GUÍA DE CÓDIGO ROJO Página: 1 de 1 SEGUIMIENTO CÓDIGO ROJO Versión: 01 Fecha: 2013-03-16 NOMBRES Y APELLIDOS: EDAD: HISTORIA CLÍNICA: EPS: FECHA: HORA DE ACTIVACIÓN: HORA DE DESACTIVACIÓN: MÉDICO(A) 1: MÉDICO(A) 2: ENFERMERO(A): ANESTESIÓLOGO(A): ASISTENTE 1: ASISTENTE 2: ASISTENTE 3: DIAGNÓSTICO: FASE DEL CÓDIGO TIEMPO CERO TIEMPO 1 - 20 MINUTOS TIEMPO 20 - 60 MINUTOS TIEMPO > 60 MINUTOS TIEMPO > 120 MINUTOS Hora de evaluación Sensorio Perfusión (seg) Frecuencia cardiaca Tensión arterial sistólica CLASIFICACIÓN DEL CHOQUE Choque leve (16-25%) Choque moderado (26-35%) Choque severo (> 35%) -Índice de choque mayor a 1 DIURESIS 1 HORA 2 HORAS 3 HORAS 4 HORAS CRISTALOIDES Cuál y cantidad: OTROS Cuál: HEMODERIVADOS (cantidad y hora de inicio) G.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: This document reﬂects emerging clinical and scientiﬁc advances as of the publication date and is subject to change.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: The information is not meant to dictate an exclusive course of treatment or procedure.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Institutions are free to amend the recommendations.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: The SOGC suggests however that they adequately document any such amendments.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Informed consent: Patients have the right and responsibility to make informed decisions about their care in partnership with their health care provider.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: In order to facilitate informed choice patients should be provided with information and support that is evidence-based culturally appropriate and personalized.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: The values beliefs and individual needs of each patient in the context of their personal circumstances should be considered and the ﬁnal decision about care and treatment options chosen by the patient should be respected.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Language and inclusivity: The SOGC recognizes the importance to be fully inclusive and when context is appropriate gender-neutral lan- guage will be used.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: In other circumstances we continue to use gendered language because of our mission to advance women’s health.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: The SOGC recognizes and respects the rights of all people for whom the information in this document may apply including but not limited to transgender non-binary and intersex people.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: The SOGC encourages health care providers to engage in respectful conversation with their patients about their gender identity and preferred gender pronouns and to apply these guidelines in a way that is sensitive to each person’s needs.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: RECOMMENDED CHANGES IN PRACTICE 1.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Quantitative blood loss measurement should replace estimated blood loss for all deliveries.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Maximum single dose oxytocin doses should be 3 IU IV rapid injection or 10 IU intramuscular 3.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: In cases of severe obstetrical hemorrhage the calculated maximum allowable blood loss and lab-based (or point-of- careebased) factor replacement should guide treatment whenever possible.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Misoprostol should only be used sublingually or orally for the prevention and treatment of postpartum hemorrhage.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: KEY MESSAGES 1.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Reducing the risk of postpartum hemorrhage begins antenatally and continued vigilance is needed throughout labour to recognize abnormal postpartum bleeding early.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Appropriate recognition and treatment of postpartum hemorrhage can prevent serious morbidity while reducing costs to the health care system by minimizing costly interventions and length of hospital stays.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Simulation training followed by formal debrieﬁng will improve outcomes in the clinical setting.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: ABSTRACT Objective: This guideline aims to provide evidence for prevention recognition and treatment of postpartum hemorrhage including severe hemorrhage leading to hemorrhagic shock.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Target population: All pregnant patients.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Beneﬁts harms and costs: Appropriate recognition and treatment of postpartum hemorrhage can prevent serious morbidity while reducing costs to the health care system by minimizing more costly interventions and length of hospital stays.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Evidence: Medical literature PubMed ClinicalTrials.gov the Cochrane Database and grey literature were searched for articles published between 2012 and 2021 on postpartum hemorrhage uterotonics obstetrical hemorrhage and massive hemorrhage protocols.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Validation methods: The authors rated the quality of evidence and strength of recommendations using the Grading of Recommendations Assessment Development and Evaluation (GRADE) approach.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: See online Appendix A (Tables A1 for deﬁnitions and A2 for interpretations of strong and conditional [weak] recommendations).

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Intended Audience: All members of the health care team who care for labouring or postpartum women including but not restricted to nurses midwives family physicians obstetricians and anesthesiologists.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: RECOMMENDATIONS 1.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: An individualized risk assessment for postpartum hemorrhage should be documented in a checklist upon arrival to a labour unit and updated throughout labour and delivery (strong high).

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: The riskassessment should include a calculation of the maximum allow- able blood loss (good practice point).

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Both antenatal and postnatal anemia should be identiﬁed and treated aggressively (strong high).

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Quantitative blood loss measurement should replace estimated blood loss in all patients whenever possible (strong moderate).

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Staging and management of postpartum hemorrhage should be based on quantitative blood loss (strong high).

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Active management of the third stage of labour should be offered to all women (strong high).

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Prophylactic intramuscular oxytocin can be used for patients at low risk for postpartum hemorrhage (strong high).

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: For patients at high risk of postpartum hemorrhage prophylactic intravenous oxytocin should be used (conditional moderate).

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: When given intravenously oxytocin can be given either as a rapid infusion (max rate 1 IU/min) for 4 minutes followed by 7.5e15 IU/h or as a 3 IU intravenous rapid injection (strong moderate) 9.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: If there is inadequate response to oxytocin within 4 minutes a second-line uterotonic should be administered (strong high).

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Carbetocin can be considered as a ﬁrst-line agent for postpartum hemorrhage prophylaxis at cesarean delivery (strong moderate).

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Bimanual uterine compression and bladder emptying should be performed as ﬁrst-line measures while waiting for pharmacologic agents to take effect (good practice point).

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Misoprostol (sublingual/oral) is an effective adjunct to prophylactic or therapeutic oxytocin in high-risk individuals (strong high) 13.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Intramuscular ergotamine and intramuscular or intramyometrial carboprost can both be used to treat active postpartum hemor- rhage (strong high).

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Rectal misoprostol is inferior to other routes (both in onset and in bioavailability) and should not be used (strong moderate).

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Tranexamic acid can be used in all patients as an adjunct to ute- rotonics in the setting of postpartum hemorrhage and can be used as a prophylactic agent in patients at high risk for postpartum hemorrhage (strong high).

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Uterine tamponade is an effective tool and should be considered for ongoing mild to moderate bleeding (conditional moderate).

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: If the placenta has not been expelled spontaneously in the 30 minutes following delivery measures should be taken to expedite delivery of the placenta (strong high).

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: When there is ongoing bleeding examine the patient for the presence of clots retained placental tissue or genital tract lacer- ations (good practice point).

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: In the case of uterine inversion if immediate reversion is not possible transfer the patient to an operating room for uterine relaxation and patient stabilization as required (good practice point) 20.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: If pharmacologic interventions have not controlled bleeding surgical intervention should be undertaken promptly (strong high) 21.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Compression sutures ligation of uterine or internal iliac arteries and uterine artery embolization are all effective interventions that can be considered however hysterectomy should not be delayed in an unstable patient (strong high).

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Severe obstetrical hemorrhage should be managed by a multi- disciplinary team consisting of obstetrics anaesthesia nursing and transfusion medicine (strong high).

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: An obstetrical massive hemorrhage protocol including deﬁned roles and responsibilities of each team member should be used (strong moderate).

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Initial resuscitative and monitoring measures should include intravenous access  2 electrocardiography oxygen saturation blood pressure placement of an indwelling urethral catheter euthermia and volume replacement with balanced crystalloid (good practice point).

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: 1294 l DECEMBER JOGC DÉCEMBRE 2022 SOGC CLINICAL PRACTICE GUIDELINE For personal use only.

text: No other uses without permission.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Elsevier Inc.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: All rights reserved.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Four units red blood cells should be given prior to other blood products in an actively bleeding patient who is approaching the maximum allowable blood loss unless the patient has a coagu- lation defect (strong moderate) 26.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Fibrinogen levels should be measured in every moderate to severe case of postpartum hemorrhage and if <2 g/L should be replaced accordingly (strong high).

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: A massive hemorrhage protocol with ratios of red blood cells to fresh frozen plasma to platelets of 1:1:1: or 2:1:1 can be used in the absence of timely lab results (strong moderate).

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Simulation training with all members of the multidisciplinary team should occur on a regular basis ideally by a trained facilitator (strong high).

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: DECEMBER JOGC DÉCEMBRE 2022 l 1295 PPH and Hemorrhagic Shock For personal use only.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: No other uses without permission.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Elsevier Inc.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: All rights reserved.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: INTRODUCTION P ostpartum hemorrhage (PPH) continues to be a sig- niﬁcant contributor to maternal morbidity and mor- tality even in developed countries.1 Between 2003 and 2010 the incidence of PPH in Canada was 5.6 per 100 deliveries.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: International data from high resource countries suggest the rate is closer to 10% when blood loss is actually measured 2and this rate continues to rise with uterine atony being the primary cause.3 4 The traditional deﬁnition of blood loss as 500 mL with vaginal delivery or 1000 mL with cesarean delivery (CD) is no longer sufﬁcient as visual estimates have been found to be inaccurate even for experienced pro- viders.5 6 In addition many women of reproductive age maintain normal vital signs despite blood loss beyond these amounts.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Since these factors can lead to delays in treatment causing adverse maternal outcomes 7 8 accurate and cumu- lative measurement of blood loss has emerged as the new standard of care.9Prevention is key to reducing maternal morbidity from PPH as 60% of these patients have at least one identiﬁable antepartum or intrapartum risk factor.10 Assessment for these risk factors as well as early intervention are integral to mitigating potential adverse outcomes.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: This guideline provides a new approach to the early identiﬁcation and management of PPH.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Recommenda- tions are based on emerging data that highlight the suc- cesses of obstetrical hemorrhage toolkits and care bundles in reducing maternal morbidity and mortality.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: The California Maternal Quality Care Collaborative implemented a quality improvement initiative that led to a reduction in PPH of 20.8% compared with 1.2% in non- participating hospitals.11 This guideline presents an adapted model to prevent and manage PPH and com- prises the following categories: 1.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: RISK ASSESSMENT2.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: RISK REDUCTION3.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: RECOGNIZE AND RE-EVALUATE4.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: REACT5.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: RESUSCITATE6.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: REVIEWRISK ASSESSMENT Causes and Risk Factors The four Ts (tone tissue trauma thrombin) are well known.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Evaluation of risk factors in each of these cate- gories is important to determine a potential cause of PPH (Table 1).

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Individualized risk should be documented in a checklist upon arrival to a labour unit and updated throughout labour and delivery (Appendix B).

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Patients at high risk for PPH deliver in a facility with easy access to a massive hemorrhage protocol (MHP) that takes into consideration local blood product supply transport and access to specialist advice.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Anemia Women with anemia (Hb <110 g/L) have less reserve to cope with PPH.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Anemia may also reduce oxygen delivery to myometrial muscles resulting in uterine atony.12 In addition iron is a necessary cofactor for adenosine triphosphate (ATP) production in muscle cells and iron deﬁciency itself may contribute to uterine atony.13Iron deﬁciency anemia is a signiﬁcant health problem for women worldwide.14 The prevalence of iron deﬁciency anemia in pregnancy is estimated at 41% with higher rates in low socioeconomic populations.14 A study conducted in Toronto Canada of pregnant women screened for iron deﬁciency anemia found that 91% of participants were iron deﬁcient (ferritin <50 mg/L) with most having severe iron deﬁciency with a ferritin < 20 mg/L despite only 25% of participants having a hemoglobin level <110 g/L.15 These ﬁndings highlight the fact that by the time a low hemoglobin is detected the iron deﬁciency is profound.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Both hemo- globin and ferritin should be measured antenatally.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Anemia and iron deﬁciency should be assessed and treated at or before 28 weeks gestation.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Ferrous salts taken daily or every other day on an empty stomach is the ideal method of iron supplementation.16 There is insufﬁcient evidence to routinely co-administer ascorbic acid (vitamin C).17 Intravenous iron should be given if there is no response (increase in Hb of 10 g/L) within 2 weeks.18Postpartum anemia contributes to fatigue postpartum depression poor bonding and poor lactation.19 20 Oral iron supplementation should continue for at least 3 months postpartum and intravenous (IV) iron considered with hemoglobin <80 g/L regardless of symptoms.16 ABBREVIATIONS CD cesarean delivery MABL maximum allowable blood loss MHP massive hemorrhage protocol PPH postpartum hemorrhage TXA tranexamic acid 1296 l DECEMBER JOGC DÉCEMBRE 2022 SOGC CLINICAL PRACTICE GUIDELINE For personal use only.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: No other uses without permission.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Elsevier Inc.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: All rights reserved.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: RISK REDUCTION The California Collaborative found that underestimating blood loss and relying on vital signs led to health care providers underestimating the severity of PPH and more importantly led to delays in treatment.11 Denial is delay should be the new theme for PPH management strate- gies.11 The beneﬁt of one or more PPH bundles (con- taining key medications instruments tamponade devices sponges sutures etc.) can decrease the time to treatment by having all potentially needed materials readily available.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Accurate Measurement of Blood Loss Since visual estimates grossly underestimate the true volume of blood loss it is recommended that labour units begin to accurately monitor and record ongoing bleeding.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Dry weights of sponges towels sheets and other commonly soaked surfaces should be recorded on a standard form thatcan be accessed at any time to properly evaluate blood loss in any patient.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Measuring amniotic ﬂuid in the drape (cali- brated cones are available) and wiping the ﬂuid off the ﬂoor before active bleeding begins will distinguish it from any postpartum bleeding.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Whenever possible suction the am- niotic ﬂuid at CD prior to delivering the infant and docu- ment its volume.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Everything suctioned after this point should be considered blood loss.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Sponges towels and drapes should be collected and weighed.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: A record of cu- mulative blood loss for the ﬁrst 24 hours should be kept.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Estimated blood loss should be replaced by quantitative (measured) blood loss (Appendices C D E F).

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Classiﬁcation and Management Protocols for Stages of Postpartum Hemorrhage A staging system based on quantitative blood loss regardless of vital signs with detailed management Table 1.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Postpartum hemorrhage risk factorsEtiology Risk Factors Tone (uterine atony) Uterine overdistension  Polyhydramnios  Multiple gestation  Macrosomia Uterine exhaustion  Precipitous or prolonged labour  Prolonged oxytocin use  High parity  General anaesthesia  Anemia Infection  Prolonged rupture of membranes  Chorioamnionitis Dysfunctional uterine activity  Fibroids  Placenta previa Tissue Retained products of conception Incomplete placental delivery (succenturiate lobe morbidly adherent placenta) Trauma Laceration of cervix vagina perineum  Precipitous or operative delivery  Episiotomy extension  Fetal malposition Extension/lacerations at cesarean  Deep engagement  Prolonged second stage  Fetal malposition Uterine rupture Previous uterine surgery Uterine inversion  Nulliparity with fundal placenta  Excessive cord traction Thrombin Pre-existing states  Hereditary coagulopathies (von Willebrand disease hemophilia)  Idiopathic thrombotic purpura Acquired in pregnancy  Preeclampsia  Disseminated intravascular coagulopathy  Fetal demise  Severe infection  Abruption  Amniotic ﬂuid embolism Iatrogenic  Therapeutic anticoagulation DECEMBER JOGC DÉCEMBRE 2022 l 1297 PPH and Hemorrhagic Shock For personal use only.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: protocols for each stage should be implemented.21 (Clas- siﬁcation in Table 2 for a more detailed table including expanded management protocols see Appendix G) Active Management of the Third Stage of Labour The SOGC ﬁrst commented on the active management of the third stage of labour in 2000.22 Three elements were originally included: a uterotonic after delivery of the anterior shoulder early cord clamping and cord traction to deliver the placenta.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Since that time delayed cord clamping has become the standard of care as it improves neonatal outcomes without increasing the incidence of PPH.23Furthermore in multiple trials and reviews controlled cord traction has been shown to only decrease the length of the third stage by 4-6 minutes and blood loss by <30 mL.24e28 Since there is limited evidence to suggest that expediting delivery of the placenta before 30 minutes reduces the risk of PPH in an uncomplicated delivery 22 the deﬁnition of active management of the third stage of labour should be conﬁned to the use of a uterotonic.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Providers choosing to employ controlled cord traction should only do so after signs of placental separation and traction should be performed with uterine contraction as these measures reduce the risk of uterine inversion cord avulsion and partial detachment of the placenta.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Although prophylaxis with oxytocin for all patients has been common practice a 2019 Cochrane review found no clear beneﬁt to routine uterotonics in terms of PPH or hemo- globin in women at low risk of PPH based on low quality evidence.29 They concluded that women at low risk for PPH should be given the necessary information regarding the beneﬁts and risks of active management of the third stage of labour in order to make informed choices about their care.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Skin to skin contact may independently reduce the length of the third stage.30Oxytocin Free Interval Prior to Cesarean Delivery The longer oxytocin is used for the induction or augmentation of labour the less responsive the uterus becomes to it.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Tran et al.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: showed a statistically signiﬁcant association between the length of the oxytocin free interval prior to CD and the total estimated blood loss with the greatest beneﬁt after 1 hour.31 While the reduction in blood loss in patients with a low BMI was not clinically signiﬁcant (7 mL/10-min recovery interval) the greatest beneﬁt was seen in women with a BMI >40 kg/m2 where blood loss was reduced by 45 mL per 10-minute recovery interval up to a maximum of 450 mL at 99 minutes.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: In these women higher amounts and longer durations of oxytocin use were associated with an increased need for a second-line uterotonic agent.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: When maternal and fetal conditions are stable providing an oxytocin wash-out in- terval may be beneﬁcial particularly when the patient’s BMI is >40 kg/m2.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Prophylactic Uterotonics (Table 3) Oxytocin Numerous trials over more than 2 decades continue to show that oxytocin is the drug of choice for both the prevention and treatment of PPH.32 Compared with pla- cebo ergometrine carboprost or misoprostol oxytocin is Table 2.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: Classiﬁcation and management of PPH by stageBlood loss mL BP mm Hga HR bpma Signs/symptoms Initial managementb Stage 0  <500 vaginal  <1000 CD Normal <100 Asymptomatic Active or physiologic management of the third stage Stage 1 (mild)  500-1000 vaginal  1000 CD Normal <110 Often asymptomatic or may have signs of severe PPH Therapeutic ﬁrst-line uterotonic Stage 2 (moderate) 1000-1500 Postural hypotension (SBP 80-100) >110 May be asymptomatic or may have signs of severe PPH  Second-line uterotonic  Look for other causes Stage 3 (severe) >1500 SBP <80 >120  Diaphoresis  Delayed capillary reﬁll time  Tachypnea  Pallor  Oliguria/anuria  Decreased level of consciousness  Agitation  Cool extremities Full resuscitation protocol aBP and HR may be variable.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: bExpanded in Appendix G.

fname: Guideline No. 431 Postpartum Hemorrhage and Hemorrhagic Shock
text: BP: blood pressure CD: cesarean delivery HR: heart rate PPH: postpartum hemorrhage SBP: systolic blood pressure.
